comments:
Build: 20020528

1. Load the three plugins that I have zipped and will attach to this bug into a 
selfhosting workspace.
2. Start the target workspace.
3. Click on the "Hello, Eclipse 
world" button that appears (you may have to Customize your perspective and add the "Sample Action 
Set").
4. You will get a walkback that looks like the following:

!SESSION May 29, 2002 
20:01:13.428 ---------------------------------------------

jitc)

win32 -arch x86
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 1 4 May 29, 2002 20:01:13.428
!MESSAGE 
Reference action not found: additions
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 1 4 May 29, 2002 
20:01:18.115
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 
May 29, 2002 20:01:18.125
!MESSAGE Class abc/A violates loader constraints:  definition 
mismatch between parent and child loaders
!STACK 0
java.lang.LinkageError: Class abc/A 
violates loader constraints:  definition mismatch between parent and child loaders
	at

	at

	at

Created an attachment (id=1116)
ABC.zip, three plugins that cause this problem

I believe that this walkback is caused by the ordering of lookups in our classloaders.  If the 
classloader looked at its parent before looking within itself it would not fail in this case.

I believe this is a dup of bug 6694: Overlaping classes in library jar files. 
Your test case is nicer so I'll close the other as a duplicate.
*** Bug 6694 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This works in Eclipse 3.0.  As expected, you now get a ClassNotFoundException
when running the example, since plugins A and B do not export their libraries. 
If they export their libraries, the example runs without failures.

traces.message: Class abc/A  violates loader constraints:  definition mismatch between parent and child loaders
